issue.title: [CF 433] Enable/Disable Icon via Keybind/Command
issue.body:
It would be nice to be able to bind the state of an icon to a keybind.  The reason I want this is there are certain situations where and icon isn't useful and can't be handled with current conditions. For example, if I had a meta icon with a rotation of abilities, but in one specific fight one of those abilities isn't needed. With a hotkey I could disable that icon and the rotational meta icon would precede to skip over it.

The implementation could be as simple as adding some parameters to the /tmw command that could be put in a macro which can then be bound to a key.
For example something along the lines of: /tmw disable GroupName Icon#
You could have enable, disable, and toggle keywords for it.

PS: Thanks for the floating combat text output. That made two less addons needed for me!


> Posted by CurseForge user pvtschlag | Imported from CurseForge issue #433 | Raw

comments.body:
I wouldn't implement actual keybinds, but a macro implementation is definitely possible.

I may also implement conditions that integrate with Big Wigs to check what boss fight you are on.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Added this functionality in r445. Copied from the recently edited description/instructions for TMW:

All available slash commands are:

  • '/tmw' - Toggles TellMeWhen between locked (functional) or unlocked (configuration) states.
  • '/tmw options' - Opens the general settings configuration for TellMeWhen.
  • '/tmw enable groupID iconID' - Enables the specified group or icon (E.g. '/tmw enable 2 4' or '/tmw enable 3').
  • '/tmw disable groupID iconID' - Disables the specified group or icon (E.g. '/tmw disable 2 4' or '/tmw disable 3').
  • '/tmw toggle groupID iconID' - Toggles the specified group or icon between enabled and disabled (E.g. '/tmw toggle 2 4' or '/tmw toggle 3').

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
